alert.note: Alert for Moffat; Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 29 at 11:05AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY RUNOFF FROM SNOWMELT WILL LEAD TO HIGH FLOWS AND INCREASING RIVER LEVELS ACROSS MANY TRIBUTARIES AND THE MAIN STEM OF THE YAMPA RIVER BY EARLY NEXT WEEK... Areas along tributaries of the Yampa River and on the main stem of the Yampa River in Northwest Colorado will likely be impacted by increasing river flows and river levels by early next week. Melting of this year`s snowpack will accelerate as temperatures continue to rise through the weekend and into early next week. Runoff into many of the tributaries of the Yampa River...especially in the upper basin...will produce rapidly increased flows by early next week. This water will continue downstream on the main stem of the Yampa River to the confluence with the Green River by the middle of next week. Impacts from these increased flows on those living adjacent to these water ways can be expected beginning with low land flooding. Banks near these swollen rivers could become unstable and should be avoided. Recreational interests should be prepared for the impacts of high flows as camping areas and access to the river may become inaccessible or inundated. Please heed local advisories and closures. Stay tuned for additional statements and/or Watches and Warnings as river levels continue to rise.
